page.title: 15HOMELIFE - THREE MOSSES
page.content: There is only sparce population in this area, and the number of families are usually employed in the surrounding area, or commute to larger towns or cities for business. As a result many wives are employed and therefore to some extent convenience food is useful. However, many of the farmers in the area still believe in good wholesome meals and the Sunday roast. T.V. and video play a large part in home entertainment, although many of the children are members of the Scout and Guide movements in the district. Many youngsters go to the Youth club in Halsall School, a little distance away. The tradition of Saturday jobs for teenagers continues and many find work on the local farms. The annual Rose Queen celebration gives many a chance to enjoy sports etc in the village.
